p: Recognising the importance of the human microbiome to health and the need to protect against pathogens whilst enabling exposure to beneficial microbes, the Royal Society for Public Health proposed the concept of ‘targeted hygiene’, whereby cleaning and disinfection is focused exclusively on areas in the home most likely to transmit pathogens, for example, food preparation surfaces such as chopping boards and utensils, sinks, and taps [ 59]. Integration of antimicrobial surfaces with this type of approach would seem ideal installing them, for example, in food preparation areas and bathrooms but not more generally in floor covering, walls, or furniture.
